error.signature: Docker build not using cache / rebuilding all layers

verdict.summary: Docker layer cache invalidated. A COPY before the layer invalidates all subsequent layers.

dead_ends.why_fails: Rebuilds everything — the opposite of what you want

dead_ends.action: Put all COPY commands at the beginning
dead_ends.why_fails: Invalidates all layers on any file change — worst ordering

workarounds.action: Order Dockerfile: system deps → copy package files → install deps → copy source
workarounds.how:
COPY package.json package-lock.json ./
RUN npm install
COPY . .  # source changes don't bust npm cache

workarounds.action: Use .dockerignore to exclude files that change frequently (logs, .git, node_modules)
Use BuildKit cache mounts for package managers: --mount=type=cache,target=/root/.cache/pip

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'Docker build not using cache / rebuilding all layers' indicates Docker build cache invalidation, while 'response from daemon' indicates a missing Docker image tag or manifest.
'Docker build not using cache / rebuilding all layers' indicates Docker build cache invalidation, while 'Container health status' indicates a failing container health check.
